definition: to pull/to tear/(of cloth, thread etc) to buy/to chat/to gossip/(coll.) (Tw) ridiculous/hokey

sentences.english: They had no time now for neighborhood gossip.
sentences.chinese: 如今，他们没有时间和周围的人闲扯。

sentences.english: He is rabbiting on about the past.
sentences.chinese: 他在闲扯一些过去的事。

sentences.english: They are chatting away about old times.
The villagers are prattling on about the village gossip.
sentences.chinese: 村民们正在闲扯些村里的事。

sentences.english: The girl likes to relax in the sofa when the others are gossiping.
sentences.chinese: 其他人闲扯时，那姑娘喜欢坐到沙发上轻松一下。

sentences.english: She prattles on about the village gossip.
They were chattering (discursively on a variety of topics) over their needlework.
sentences.chinese: 她们一边做针线活一边闲扯个不停。

sentences.english: Based on the official system and the ground-based economy, in future we have time to cackle.
sentences.chinese: 关于官本位制度和地本位经济，以后有时间再闲扯。

sentences.english: It meant you'd rather submit to the words of some white dude than shoot the breeze with your neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 这意味着你宁可听那些白人说话，也不要和邻居闲扯。

sentences.english: Who cackle, often means different connotations.
sentences.chinese: 谁来闲扯，往往意味着不同的内涵。

sentences.english: The speaker rambled on about the topic for hours.
sentences.chinese: 演讲者绕着主题闲扯了好几个小时。

definition: to talk about this and that (idiom); to ramble incoherently

pinyin: you3 yi1 da1 mei2 yi1 da1

definition: variant of 閒談|闲谈[xian2 tan2]
to chatter idly/to gossip/to boast or brag
long-winded/garrulous/to talk endlessly without getting to the point
casual conversation/chat/gossip/to talk about (whatever comes to mind)
erhua variant of 聊天[liao2 tian1]
